s1.chinese: 太史公讀春秋歷譜諜，至周厲王，未嘗不廢書而嘆也。
s1.literal: The Grand Historian read the Spring and Autumn Annals, the chronological tables, and the secret records, but whenever he reached King Li of Zhou, he could not help but set down his book and sigh.
s1.idiomatic: The Grand Historian read the Spring and Autumn Annals, the chronological tables, and the secret records, but whenever he reached King Li of Zhou, he could not help but set down his book and sigh.

s2.literal: He said: 'Alas, Master Zhi foresaw it!'
s2.idiomatic: He said: 'Alas, Master Zhi foresaw it!'

s3.literal: When Zhou made ivory chopsticks, Jizi sighed.
s3.idiomatic: When Zhou made ivory chopsticks, Jizi sighed.

s4.chinese: 周道缺，詩人本之衽席，關雎作。
s4.literal: When the Zhou way declined, poets based themselves on the bedchamber, and 'Guan Ju' was composed.
s4.idiomatic: When the Zhou way declined, poets based themselves on the bedchamber, and 'Guan Ju' was composed.

s5.literal: When benevolence and righteousness decayed, 'Lu Ming' criticized it.
s5.idiomatic: When benevolence and righteousness decayed, 'Lu Ming' criticized it.

s6.chinese: 及至厲王，以惡聞其過，公卿懼誅而禍作，厲王遂奔于彘，亂自京師始，而共和行政焉。
s6.literal: When it came to King Li, because he hated to hear of his faults, the ministers feared execution and disaster arose. King Li fled to Zhi, and disorder began in the capital. The Gonghe administered government.
s6.idiomatic: When it came to King Li, because he hated to hear of his faults, the ministers feared execution and disaster arose. King Li fled to Zhi, and disorder began in the capital. The Gonghe administered government.

s7.chinese: 是後或力政，彊乘弱，興師不請天子。
s7.literal: After this, some ruled by force, the strong oppressed the weak, they raised armies without asking the Son of Heaven.
s7.idiomatic: After this, some ruled by force, the strong oppressed the weak, they raised armies without asking the Son of Heaven.

s8.chinese: 然挾王室之義，以討伐為會盟主，政由五伯，諸侯恣行，淫侈不軌，賊臣篡子滋起矣。
s8.literal: Yet upholding the righteousness of the royal house, they made punitive expeditions as lords of alliances. Politics came from the Five Hegemons, feudal lords acted wantonly, extravagant and lawless, traitorous ministers and usurping sons arose increasingly.
s8.idiomatic: Yet upholding the righteousness of the royal house, they made punitive expeditions as lords of alliances. Politics came from the Five Hegemons, feudal lords acted wantonly, extravagant and lawless, traitorous ministers and usurping sons arose increasingly.

s9.chinese: 齊、晉、秦、楚其在成周微甚，封或百里或五十里。
s9.literal: Qi, Jin, Qin, and Chu were insignificant in the time of prosperous Zhou, their fiefs only a hundred li or fifty li.
s9.idiomatic: Qi, Jin, Qin, and Chu were insignificant in the time of prosperous Zhou, their fiefs only a hundred li or fifty li.

s10.chinese: 晉阻三河，齊負東海，楚介江淮，秦因雍州之固，四海迭興，更為伯主，文武所褒大封，皆威而服焉。
s10.literal: Jin blocked the three rivers, Qi faced the eastern sea, Chu bordered the Jiang and Huai, Qin relied on the defenses of Yong province. The four seas rose in succession, replacing each other as hegemonic lords. Those praised and greatly enfeoffed by Wen and Wu all inspired awe and submission.
s10.idiomatic: Jin blocked the three rivers, Qi faced the eastern sea, Chu bordered the Jiang and Huai, Qin relied on the defenses of Yong province. The four seas rose in succession, replacing each other as hegemonic lords. Those praised and greatly enfeoffed by Wen and Wu all inspired awe and submission.

s11.chinese: 是以孔子明王道，干七十餘君，莫能用，故西觀周室，論史記舊聞，興於魯而次春秋，上記隱，下至哀之獲麟，約其辭文，去其煩重，以制義法，王道備，人事浹。
s11.literal: This is why Confucius clarified the way of kings, petitioned more than seventy rulers, but none could employ him. Therefore he observed the western Zhou court, discussed historical records and old traditions, arose in Lu and arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording from Yin above to the capture of the unicorn in Ai below, condensing their wording and style, removing their tedious repetitions, to establish righteous principles. The way of kings was complete, human affairs thorough.
s11.idiomatic: This is why Confucius clarified the way of kings, petitioned more than seventy rulers, but none could employ him. Therefore he observed the western Zhou court, discussed historical records and old traditions, arose in Lu and arranged the Spring and Autumn Annals, recording from Yin above to the capture of the unicorn in Ai below, condensing their wording and style, removing their tedious repetitions, to establish righteous principles. The way of kings was complete, human affairs thorough.

s12.chinese: 七十子之徒口受其傳指，為有所刺譏褒諱挹損之文辭不可以書見也。
s12.literal: The disciples of the seventy worthies orally received his transmitted teachings, for there were passages of criticism, mockery, praise, concealment, and depreciation in the wording that could not be shown in writing.
s12.idiomatic: The disciples of the seventy worthies orally received his transmitted teachings, for there were passages of criticism, mockery, praise, concealment, and depreciation in the wording that could not be shown in writing.

s13.chinese: 魯君子左丘明懼弟子人人異端，各安其意，失其真，故因孔子史記具論其語，成左氏春秋。
s13.literal: The Lu gentleman Zuoqiu Ming feared that disciples would each follow different doctrines, each comfortable with their own opinions, losing the truth, so based on Confucius's historical records he comprehensively discussed their sayings, completing the Zuo Tradition Spring and Autumn Annals.
s13.idiomatic: The Lu gentleman Zuoqiu Ming feared that disciples would each follow different doctrines, each comfortable with their own opinions, losing the truth, so based on Confucius's historical records he comprehensively discussed their sayings, completing the Zuo Tradition Spring and Autumn Annals.

s14.chinese: 鐸椒為楚威王傳，為王不能盡觀春秋，采取成敗，卒四十章，為鐸氏微。
s14.literal: Duo Jiao wrote a commentary for King Wei of Chu, but the king could not read the entire Spring and Autumn Annals, so he selected successes and failures, finally making forty chapters, calling it the Duo Family Annals.
s14.idiomatic: Duo Jiao wrote a commentary for King Wei of Chu, but the king could not read the entire Spring and Autumn Annals, so he selected successes and failures, finally making forty chapters, calling it the Duo Family Annals.

s15.chinese: 趙孝成王時，其相虞卿上采春秋，下觀近勢，亦著八篇，為虞氏春秋。
s15.literal: In the time of King Xiaocheng of Zhao, his chancellor Yu Qing selected from the Spring and Autumn Annals above and observed recent trends below, also writing eight chapters, calling it the Yu Family Spring and Autumn Annals.
s15.idiomatic: In the time of King Xiaocheng of Zhao, his chancellor Yu Qing selected from the Spring and Autumn Annals above and observed recent trends below, also writing eight chapters, calling it the Yu Family Spring and Autumn Annals.

s16.chinese: 呂不韋者，秦莊襄王相，亦上觀尚古，刪拾春秋，集六國時事，以為八覽、六論、十二紀，為呂氏春秋。
s16.literal: Lü Buwei was chancellor to King Zhuangxiang of Qin, and also looked up to revere antiquity, edited and collected from the Spring and Autumn Annals, gathered events from the time of the six states, making them into eight surveys, six discussions, and twelve records, calling it the Lü Family Spring and Autumn Annals.
s16.idiomatic: Lü Buwei was chancellor to King Zhuangxiang of Qin, and also looked up to revere antiquity, edited and collected from the Spring and Autumn Annals, gathered events from the time of the six states, making them into eight surveys, six discussions, and twelve records, calling it the Lü Family Spring and Autumn Annals.

s17.chinese: 及如荀卿、孟子、公孫固、韓非之徒，各往往捃摭春秋之文以著書，不同勝紀。
s17.literal: And like Xun Qing, Mencius, Gongsun Gu, and Han Fei and their followers, each collected fragments from the Spring and Autumn Annals' text to write books, differing greatly in their accounts.
s17.idiomatic: And like Xun Qing, Mencius, Gongsun Gu, and Han Fei and their followers, each collected fragments from the Spring and Autumn Annals' text to write books, differing greatly in their accounts.

s18.chinese: 漢相張蒼歷譜五德，上大夫董仲舒推春秋義，頗著文焉。
s18.literal: The Han chancellor Zhang Cang calendared the five virtues, the senior grand master Dong Zhongshu expounded the Spring and Autumn Annals' principles, and wrote quite extensively about them.
s18.idiomatic: The Han chancellor Zhang Cang calendared the five virtues, the senior grand master Dong Zhongshu expounded the Spring and Autumn Annals' principles, and wrote quite extensively about them.

s3016.idiomatic: Twenty-two, extinguished Yu and Guo. Chong Er fled to Di.

s3031.literal: Thirty-two, led feudal lords to attack Zheng.
s3031.idiomatic: Thirty-two, led feudal lords to attack Zheng.

s3032.literal: Twenty-three, Yi Wu fled to Liang.
s3032.idiomatic: Twenty-three, Yi Wu fled to Liang.

s3034.chinese: 十八伐許，許君肉袒謝，楚從之。
s3034.literal: Eighteen, attacked Xu, Xu lord bared flesh to apologize, Chu followed.
s3034.idiomatic: Eighteen, attacked Xu, Xu lord bared flesh to apologize, Chu followed.

s3061.literal: Twenty-five, King Xiang established, feared Tai Shu.
s3061.idiomatic: Twenty-five, King Xiang established, feared Tai Shu.

s3064.literal: Twenty-five, attacked Di, because of Chong Er.
s3064.idiomatic: Twenty-five, attacked Di, because of Chong Er.

s3067.chinese: 三十公疾，太子茲父讓兄目夷賢，公不聽。
s3067.literal: Thirty, duke ill, Crown Prince Zi Fu yielded to elder brother Mu Yi as worthy, duke did not listen.
s3067.idiomatic: Thirty, duke ill, Crown Prince Zi Fu yielded to elder brother Mu Yi as worthy, duke did not listen.

s3071.literal: First year of Duke Gong of Cao
s3071.idiomatic: First year of Duke Gong of Cao

s3077.literal: First year of King Xiang, feudal lords established the king.
s3077.idiomatic: First year of King Xiang, feudal lords established the king.

s3078.chinese: 九齊率我伐晉亂，至高梁還。
s3078.literal: Nine, Qi led us to attack Jin's chaos, returned at Gao Liang.
s3078.idiomatic: Nine, Qi led us to attack Jin's chaos, returned at Gao Liang.

s3079.chinese: 三十五夏，會諸侯于葵丘。天子使宰孔賜胙，命無拜。
s3079.literal: Thirty-five, summer, assembled feudal lords at Kui Qiu. The Son of Heaven sent minister Kong to grant sacrificial meat, commanded no bowing.
s3079.idiomatic: Thirty-five, summer, assembled feudal lords at Kui Qiu. The Son of Heaven sent minister Kong to grant sacrificial meat, commanded no bowing.

s3080.chinese: 二十六公卒，立奚齊，里克殺之。及卓子。立夷吾。
s3080.literal: Twenty-six, duke died, established Xi Qi, Li Ke assassinated him and Zhu Zi. Established Yi Wu.
s3080.idiomatic: Twenty-six, duke died, established Xi Qi, Li Ke assassinated him and Zhu Zi. Established Yi Wu.

s3081.literal: Nine, Yi Wu sent Xi Rui with bribes to seek entry.
s3081.idiomatic: Nine, Yi Wu sent Xi Rui with bribes to seek entry.

s3083.chinese: 三十一公薨，未葬，齊桓會葵丘。
s3083.literal: Thirty-one, duke died, not yet buried, Qi Huan assembled Kui Qiu.
s3083.idiomatic: Thirty-one, duke died, not yet buried, Qi Huan assembled Kui Qiu.

s3095.chinese: 三十六使隰朋立晉惠公。
s3095.literal: Thirty-six, sent Xi Peng to establish Jin Duke Hui.
s3095.idiomatic: Thirty-six, sent Xi Peng to establish Jin Duke Hui.

s3096.chinese: 晉惠公夷吾元年誅里克，倍秦約。
s3096.literal: First year of Jin Duke Hui (Yi Wu), executed Li Ke, broke Qin alliance.
s3096.idiomatic: First year of Jin Duke Hui (Yi Wu), executed Li Ke, broke Qin alliance.

s3097.literal: Ten, Pi Zheng Zi Bao fled came.
s3097.idiomatic: Ten, Pi Zheng Zi Bao fled came.

s3099.chinese: 宋襄公茲父元年目夷相。
s3099.literal: First year of Duke Xiang of Song (Zi Fu), Mu Yi as chancellor.
s3099.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xiang of Song (Zi Fu), Mu Yi as chancellor.

s3109.chinese: 三戎伐我，太叔帶召之。欲誅叔帶，叔帶奔齊。
s3109.literal: Three, Rong attacked us, Tai Shu Dai summoned them. Wished to execute Shu Dai, Shu Dai fled to Qi.
s3109.idiomatic: Three, Rong attacked us, Tai Shu Dai summoned them. Wished to execute Shu Dai, Shu Dai fled to Qi.

s3113.literal: Eleven, rescued king attacked Rong, Rong withdrew.
s3113.idiomatic: Eleven, rescued king attacked Rong, Rong withdrew.

s3120.chinese: 二十四有妾夢天與之蘭，生穆公蘭。
s3120.literal: Twenty-four, consort dreamed heaven gave orchid, gave birth to Duke Mu Lan.
s3120.idiomatic: Twenty-four, consort dreamed heaven gave orchid, gave birth to Duke Mu Lan.

s3127.chinese: 三十八使管仲平戎于周，欲以上卿禮，讓，受下卿。
s3127.literal: Thirty-eight, sent Guan Zhong to pacify Rong at Zhou, wished to use upper minister ritual, declined, accepted lower minister.
s3127.idiomatic: Thirty-eight, sent Guan Zhong to pacify Rong at Zhou, wished to use upper minister ritual, declined, accepted lower minister.

s3143.chinese: 三十九使仲孫請王，言叔帶，王怒。
s3143.literal: Thirty-nine, sent Zhong Sun to request king, spoke of Shu Dai, king angered.
s3143.idiomatic: Thirty-nine, sent Zhong Sun to request king, spoke of Shu Dai, king angered.

s3144.literal: Four, famine, requested grain, Qin gave us.
s3144.idiomatic: Four, famine, requested grain, Qin gave us.

s3145.chinese: 十三丕豹欲無與，公不聽，輸晉粟，起雍至絳。
s3145.literal: Thirteen, Pi Bao wished not to give, duke did not listen, transported Jin grain, from Yong to Jiang.
s3145.idiomatic: Thirteen, Pi Bao wished not to give, duke did not listen, transported Jin grain, from Yong to Jiang.

s3149.literal: First year of Duke Mu of Chen (Kuan)
s3149.idiomatic: First year of Duke Mu of Chen (Kuan)

s3160.literal: Five, Qin famine, requested grain, Jin broke it.
s3160.idiomatic: Five, Qin famine, requested grain, Jin broke it.

s3174.chinese: 十五五月，日有食之。不書，史官失之。
s3174.literal: Fifteen, fifth month, solar eclipse. Not recorded, historian erred.
s3174.idiomatic: Fifteen, fifth month, solar eclipse. Not recorded, historian erred.

s3176.literal: Six, Qin captured Duke Hui, re-established him.
s3176.idiomatic: Six, Qin captured Duke Hui, re-established him.

s3177.chinese: 十五以盜食善馬士得破晉。
s3177.literal: Fifteen, because robber ate good horse knight obtained broke Jin.
s3177.idiomatic: Fifteen, because robber ate good horse knight obtained broke Jin.

s3182.literal: First year of Duke Zhuang of Cai (Jia Wu)
s3182.idiomatic: First year of Duke Zhuang of Cai (Jia Wu)

s3191.chinese: 四十二王以戎寇告齊，齊徵諸侯戍周。
s3191.literal: Forty-two, king with Rong invaders informed Qi, Qi summoned feudal lords to defend Zhou.
s3191.idiomatic: Forty-two, king with Rong invaders informed Qi, Qi summoned feudal lords to defend Zhou.

s3192.chinese: 七重耳聞管仲死，去翟之齊。
s3192.literal: Seven, Chong Er heard Guan Zhong died, left Di to Qi.
s3192.idiomatic: Seven, Chong Er heard Guan Zhong died, left Di to Qi.

s3193.literal: Sixteen, established officials for east of river.
s3193.idiomatic: Sixteen, established officials for east of river.

s3195.chinese: 七隕五石。六鷁退飛，過我都。
s3195.literal: Seven, five stones fell. Six lu retreated flying, passed our capital.
s3195.idiomatic: Seven, five stones fell. Six lu retreated flying, passed our capital.

s3223.literal: First year of Duke Xiao of Qi (Zhao)
s3223.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xiao of Qi (Zhao)

s3241.chinese: 十九滅梁。梁好城，不居，民罷，相驚，故亡。
s3241.literal: Nineteen, extinguished Liang. Liang fond of fortifying, did not dwell, people exhausted, mutually alarmed, therefore perished.
s3241.idiomatic: Nineteen, extinguished Liang. Liang fond of fortifying, did not dwell, people exhausted, mutually alarmed, therefore perished.

s3274.chinese: 三十三執宋襄公，復歸之。
s3274.literal: Thirty-three, seized Duke Xiang of Song, returned him.
s3274.idiomatic: Thirty-three, seized Duke Xiang of Song, returned him.

s3285.literal: Fourteen, Shu Dai returned to Zhou.
s3285.idiomatic: Fourteen, Shu Dai returned to Zhou.

s3287.literal: Five, returned king's younger brother Dai.
s3287.idiomatic: Five, returned king's younger brother Dai.

s3288.literal: Thirteen, crown prince Yu hostage Qin fled returned.
s3288.idiomatic: Thirteen, crown prince Yu hostage Qin fled returned.

s3291.literal: Thirteen, Hong battle, Chu defeated duke.
s3291.idiomatic: Thirteen, Hong battle, Chu defeated duke.

s3296.literal: Thirty-five, duke went to Chu, Song attacked us.
s3296.idiomatic: Thirty-five, duke went to Chu, Song attacked us.

s3303.literal: Six, attacked Song, because did not join alliance.
s3303.idiomatic: Six, attacked Song, because did not join alliance.

s3304.literal: Fourteen, Yu established, became Duke Huai.
s3304.idiomatic: Fourteen, Yu established, became Duke Huai.

s3305.chinese: 二十三迎重耳於楚，厚禮之，妻之女。重耳願歸。
s3305.literal: Twenty-three, welcomed Chong Er from Chu, treated him thickly, married daughter. Chong Er wished to return.
s3305.idiomatic: Twenty-three, welcomed Chong Er from Chu, treated him thickly, married daughter. Chong Er wished to return.

s3306.literal: Thirty-five, Chong Er passed, treated thickly.
s3306.idiomatic: Thirty-five, Chong Er passed, treated thickly.

s3307.literal: Fourteen, duke died from Hong battle.
s3307.idiomatic: Fourteen, duke died from Hong battle.

s3308.chinese: 二十三重耳從齊過，無禮。
s3308.literal: Twenty-three, Chong Er from Qi passed, no courtesy.
s3308.idiomatic: Twenty-three, Chong Er from Qi passed, no courtesy.

s3311.chinese: 十六重耳過，無禮，僖負羈私善。
s3311.literal: Sixteen, Chong Er passed, no courtesy, Xi Fu Ji privately befriended.
s3311.idiomatic: Sixteen, Chong Er passed, no courtesy, Xi Fu Ji privately befriended.

s3312.chinese: 三十六重耳過，無禮，叔詹諫。
s3312.literal: Thirty-six, Chong Er passed, no courtesy, Shu Zhan admonished.
s3312.idiomatic: Thirty-six, Chong Er passed, no courtesy, Shu Zhan admonished.

s3317.literal: Sixteen, king fled to Si. Si is Zheng territory.
s3317.idiomatic: Sixteen, king fled to Si. Si is Zheng territory.

s3320.chinese: 晉文公元年誅子圉。魏武子為魏大夫，趙衰為原大夫。咎犯曰「求霸莫如內王。」
s3320.literal: First year of Duke Wen of Jin, executed Zi Yu. Wei Wu Zi as Wei grandee, Zhao Shuai as Yuan grandee. Jiu Fan said 'seek hegemony none better than bringing in king.'
s3320.idiomatic: First year of Duke Wen of Jin, executed Zi Yu. Wei Wu Zi as Wei grandee, Zhao Shuai as Yuan grandee. Jiu Fan said 'seek hegemony none better than bringing in king.'

s3321.literal: Twenty-four, sent troops to send Chong Er.
s3321.idiomatic: Twenty-four, sent troops to send Chong Er.

s3323.literal: First year of Duke Cheng of Song (Wang Chen)
s3323.idiomatic: First year of Duke Cheng of Song (Wang Chen)

s3337.literal: Twenty-five, wished to bring in king, army at river.
s3337.idiomatic: Twenty-five, wished to bring in king, army at river.

s3355.literal: Three, doubly allied with Chu and became close to Jin.
s3355.idiomatic: Three, doubly allied with Chu and became close to Jin.

s3356.literal: First year of Duke Cheng of Wei (Zheng)
s3356.idiomatic: First year of Duke Cheng of Wei (Zheng)

s3367.chinese: 十孝公薨，弟潘因衛公子開方殺孝公子，立潘。
s3367.literal: Ten, Duke Xiao died, younger brother Pan used Wei's Gong Zi Kai Fang to assassinate Duke Xiao's son, established Pan.
s3367.idiomatic: Ten, Duke Xiao died, younger brother Pan used Wei's Gong Zi Kai Fang to assassinate Duke Xiao's son, established Pan.

s3368.literal: Four, rescued Song, avenged Cao and Wei's humiliation.
s3368.idiomatic: Four, rescued Song, avenged Cao and Wei's humiliation.

s3370.literal: Thirty-nine, sent Zi Yu to attack Song.
s3370.idiomatic: Thirty-nine, sent Zi Yu to attack Song.

s3371.literal: Four, Chu attacked us, we urgently appealed to Jin.
s3371.idiomatic: Four, Chu attacked us, we urgently appealed to Jin.

s3381.literal: Twenty, king hunted at He Yang.
s3381.idiomatic: Twenty, king hunted at He Yang.

s3382.literal: Twenty-eight, duke went to Jian Tu to assemble for audience.
s3382.idiomatic: Twenty-eight, duke went to Jian Tu to assemble for audience.

s3383.chinese: 齊昭公潘元年會晉敗楚，朝周王。
s3383.literal: First year of Duke Zhao of Qi (Pan), assembled with Jin to defeat Chu, audience with Zhou king.
s3383.idiomatic: First year of Duke Zhao of Qi (Pan), assembled with Jin to defeat Chu, audience with Zhou king.

s3384.chinese: 五侵曹伐衛，取五鹿，執曹伯。諸侯敗楚而朝河陽，周命賜公土地。
s3384.literal: Five, invaded Cao and attacked Wei, took Wu Lu, seized Cao lord. Feudal lords defeated Chu and audience at He Yang, Zhou mandate granted duke land.
s3384.idiomatic: Five, invaded Cao and attacked Wei, took Wu Lu, seized Cao lord. Feudal lords defeated Chu and audience at He Yang, Zhou mandate granted duke land.

s3385.literal: Twenty-eight, assembled with Jin to attack Chu and audience with Zhou.
s3385.idiomatic: Twenty-eight, assembled with Jin to attack Chu and audience with Zhou.

s3386.literal: Forty, Jin defeated Zi Yu at Cheng Pu.
s3386.idiomatic: Forty, Jin defeated Zi Yu at Cheng Pu.

s3387.literal: Five, Jin rescued us, Chu troops withdrew.
s3387.idiomatic: Five, Jin rescued us, Chu troops withdrew.

s3388.chinese: 三晉伐我，取五鹿。公出奔，立公子瑕會晉朝，復歸衛。
s3388.literal: Three, Jin attacked us, took Wu Lu. Duke fled, established Gong Zi Xia assembled with Jin for audience, returned to Wei.
s3388.idiomatic: Three, Jin attacked us, took Wu Lu. Duke fled, established Gong Zi Xia assembled with Jin for audience, returned to Wei.

s3389.literal: Sixteen, assembled with Jin to attack Chu, audience with Zhou king.
s3389.idiomatic: Sixteen, assembled with Jin to attack Chu, audience with Zhou king.

s3390.literal: Fourteen, assembled with Jin to attack Chu, audience with Zhou king.
s3390.idiomatic: Fourteen, assembled with Jin to attack Chu, audience with Zhou king.

s3391.chinese: 二十一晉伐我，執公，復歸之。
s3391.literal: Twenty-one, Jin attacked us, seized duke, then returned him.
s3391.idiomatic: Twenty-one, Jin attacked us, seized duke, then returned him.

s3404.literal: Four, Jin gave Wei to Song.
s3404.idiomatic: Four, Jin gave Wei to Song.

s3405.literal: First year of Duke Gong of Chen (Shuo)
s3405.idiomatic: First year of Duke Gong of Chen (Shuo)

s3416.chinese: 七聽周歸衛成公。與秦圍鄭。
s3416.literal: Seven, listened to Zhou and returned Duke Cheng of Wei. Allied with Qin to besiege Zheng.
s3416.idiomatic: Seven, listened to Zhou and returned Duke Cheng of Wei. Allied with Qin to besiege Zheng.

s3417.literal: Thirty, besieged Zheng, upon hearing words withdrew.
s3417.idiomatic: Thirty, besieged Zheng, upon hearing words withdrew.

s3420.literal: Five, Zhou entered Duke Cheng, restored Wei.
s3420.idiomatic: Five, Zhou entered Duke Cheng, restored Wei.

s3424.chinese: 四十三秦、晉圍我，以晉故。
s3424.literal: Forty-three, Qin and Jin besieged us, because of Jin.
s3424.idiomatic: Forty-three, Qin and Jin besieged us, because of Jin.

s3449.chinese: 三十二將襲鄭，蹇叔曰不可。
s3449.literal: Thirty-two, about to raid Zheng, Jian Shu said it was not permissible.
s3449.idiomatic: Thirty-two, about to raid Zheng, Jian Shu said it was not permissible.

s3464.chinese: 晉襄公驩元年破秦于殽。
s3464.literal: First year of Duke Xiang of Jin (Huan), defeated Qin at Xiao.
s3464.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xiang of Jin (Huan), defeated Qin at Xiao.

s3465.literal: Thirty-three, raided Zheng, Jin defeated us at Xiao.
s3465.idiomatic: Thirty-three, raided Zheng, Jin defeated us at Xiao.

s3472.chinese: 鄭穆公蘭元年秦襲我，弦高詐之。
s3472.literal: First year of Duke Mu of Zheng (Lan), Qin raided us, Xian Gao deceived them.
s3472.idiomatic: First year of Duke Mu of Zheng (Lan), Qin raided us, Xian Gao deceived them.

s3478.literal: First year of Duke Wen of Lu (Xing)
s3478.idiomatic: First year of Duke Wen of Lu (Xing)

s3480.literal: Two, attacked Wei, Wei attacked us.
s3480.idiomatic: Two, attacked Wei, Wei attacked us.

s3481.chinese: 三十四敗殽將亡歸，公復其官。
s3481.literal: Thirty-four, defeated at Xiao about to flee and return, duke restored their offices.
s3481.idiomatic: Thirty-four, defeated at Xiao about to flee and return, duke restored their offices.

s3482.chinese: 四十六王欲殺太子立職，太子恐，與傅潘崇殺王。王欲食熊蹯死，不聽。自立為王。
s3482.literal: Forty-six, king wished to kill crown prince and establish Zhi, crown prince feared, with tutor Pan Chong assassinated king. King wished to eat bear paw and die, they did not permit. Self-established as king.
s3482.idiomatic: Forty-six, king wished to kill crown prince and establish Zhi, crown prince feared, with tutor Pan Chong assassinated king. King wished to eat bear paw and die, they did not permit. Self-established as king.

s3484.literal: Nine, Jin attacked us, we attacked Jin.
s3484.idiomatic: Nine, Jin attacked us, we attacked Jin.

s3496.literal: Three, Qin avenged our Xiao defeat, defeated us at Wang.
s3496.idiomatic: Three, Qin avenged our Xiao defeat, defeated us at Wang.

s3497.chinese: 三十五伐晉報殽，敗我于汪。
s3497.literal: Thirty-five, attacked Jin to avenge Xiao, defeated us at Wang.
s3497.idiomatic: Thirty-five, attacked Jin to avenge Xiao, defeated us at Wang.

s3498.chinese: 楚穆王商臣元年以其太子宅賜崇，為相。
s3498.literal: First year of King Mu of Chu (Shang Chen), granted his crown prince's residence to Chong, made him chancellor.
s3498.idiomatic: First year of King Mu of Chu (Shang Chen), granted his crown prince's residence to Chong, made him chancellor.

s3512.chinese: 四秦伐我，取王官，我不出。
s3512.literal: Four, Qin attacked us, took Wang Guan, we did not go out.
s3512.idiomatic: Four, Qin attacked us, took Wang Guan, we did not go out.

s3513.chinese: 三十六以孟明等伐晉，晉不敢出。
s3513.literal: Thirty-six, with Meng Ming and others attacked Jin, Jin did not dare go out.
s3513.idiomatic: Thirty-six, with Meng Ming and others attacked Jin, Jin did not dare go out.

s3528.literal: Five, attacked Qin, besieged Yuan and Xin Cheng.
s3528.idiomatic: Five, attacked Qin, besieged Yuan and Xin Cheng.

s3529.chinese: 三十七晉伐我，圍邧、新城。
s3529.literal: Thirty-seven, Jin attacked us, besieged Yuan and Xin Cheng.
s3529.idiomatic: Thirty-seven, Jin attacked us, besieged Yuan and Xin Cheng.

s3544.chinese: 六趙成子、欒貞子、霍伯、臼季皆卒。
s3544.literal: Six, Zhao Cheng Zi, Luan Zhen Zi, Huo Bo, Jiu Ji all died.
s3544.idiomatic: Six, Zhao Cheng Zi, Luan Zhen Zi, Huo Bo, Jiu Ji all died.

s3560.chinese: 七公卒。趙盾為太子少，欲更立君，恐誅，遂立太子為靈公。
s3560.literal: Seven, duke died. Zhao Dun was crown prince young, wished to change ruler, feared execution, therefore established crown prince as Ling Gong.
s3560.idiomatic: Seven, duke died. Zhao Dun was crown prince young, wished to change ruler, feared execution, therefore established crown prince as Ling Gong.

s3561.chinese: 三十九繆公薨。葬殉以人，從死者百七十人，君子譏之，故不言卒。
s3561.literal: Thirty-nine, Duke Mu died. Buried with human sacrifice, those who died 170 people, gentleman criticized, therefore did not say died.
s3561.idiomatic: Thirty-nine, Duke Mu died. Buried with human sacrifice, those who died 170 people, gentleman criticized, therefore did not say died.

s3576.chinese: 晉靈公夷皋元年趙盾專政。
s3576.literal: First year of Duke Ling of Jin (Yi Gao), Zhao Dun monopolized government.
s3576.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ling of Jin (Yi Gao), Zhao Dun monopolized government.

s3577.literal: First year of Duke Kang of Qin (Ying)
s3577.idiomatic: First year of Duke Kang of Qin (Ying)

s3579.literal: Seventeen, Gong Sun Gu killed Cheng Gong.
s3579.idiomatic: Seventeen, Gong Sun Gu killed Cheng Gong.

s3590.chinese: 八王使衛來求金以葬，非禮。
s3590.literal: Eight, king sent Wei to seek gold for burial, not according to ritual.
s3590.idiomatic: Eight, king sent Wei to seek gold for burial, not according to ritual.

s3592.chinese: 二秦伐我，取武城，報令孤之戰。
s3592.literal: Two, Qin attacked us, took Wu Cheng, avenged Ling Gu battle.
s3592.idiomatic: Two, Qin attacked us, took Wu Cheng, avenged Ling Gu battle.

s3595.chinese: 宋昭公杵臼元年襄公之子。
s3595.literal: First year of Duke Zhao of Song (Chu Jiu), Xiang Gong's son.
s3595.idiomatic: First year of Duke Zhao of Song (Chu Jiu), Xiang Gong's son.

s3608.literal: Three, led feudal lords to rescue Zheng.
s3608.idiomatic: Three, led feudal lords to rescue Zheng.

s3610.literal: Eight, attacked Zheng, because submitted to Jin.
s3610.idiomatic: Eight, attacked Zheng, because submitted to Jin.

s3624.chinese: 四伐秦，拔少梁。秦取我北徵。
s3624.literal: Four, attacked Qin, took Shao Liang. Qin took our Bei Zheng.
s3624.idiomatic: Four, attacked Qin, took Shao Liang. Qin took our Bei Zheng.

s3625.chinese: 四晉伐我，取少梁。我伐晉取北徵。
s3625.literal: Four, Jin attacked us, took Shao Liang. We attacked Jin took Bei Zheng.
s3625.idiomatic: Four, Jin attacked us, took Shao Liang. We attacked Jin took Bei Zheng.

s3631.literal: First year of Duke Wen of Cao (Shou)
s3631.idiomatic: First year of Duke Wen of Cao (Shou)

s3633.literal: First year of Duke Huan of Yan
s3633.idiomatic: First year of Duke Huan of Yan

s3638.chinese: 十一敗長翟于鹹而歸，得長翟。
s3638.literal: Eleven, defeated Tall Di at Xian, returned, got Tall Di.
s3638.idiomatic: Eleven, defeated Tall Di at Xian, returned, got Tall Di.

s3643.literal: Four, defeated Tall Di at Chang Qiu.
s3643.idiomatic: Four, defeated Tall Di at Chang Qiu.

s3656.chinese: 六秦取我羈馬。與秦戰河曲，秦師遁。
s3656.literal: Six, Qin took our Ji Ma. Fought Qin at He Qu, Qin army fled.
s3656.idiomatic: Six, Qin took our Ji Ma. Fought Qin at He Qu, Qin army fled.

s3657.chinese: 六伐晉，取羈馬。怒，與我大戰河曲。
s3657.literal: Six, attacked Jin, took Ji Ma. Angry, fought great battle with us at He Qu.
s3657.idiomatic: Six, attacked Jin, took Ji Ma. Angry, fought great battle with us at He Qu.

s3673.literal: Seven, Jin deceived got Sui Hui.
s3673.idiomatic: Seven, Jin deceived got Sui Hui.

s3685.chinese: 六頃王崩。公卿爭政，故不赴。
s3685.literal: Six, King Qing died. Ministers contended for government, therefore did not report death.
s3685.idiomatic: Six, King Qing died. Ministers contended for government, therefore did not report death.

s3686.chinese: 十四彗星入北斗，周史曰：七年，宋、齊、晉君死。
s3686.literal: Fourteen, comet entered Northern Dipper, Zhou historian said: seven years, Song, Qi, Jin rulers die.
s3686.idiomatic: Fourteen, comet entered Northern Dipper, Zhou historian said: seven years, Song, Qi, Jin rulers die.

s4331.idiomatic: Three, Chu attacked Peng Cheng, enfeoffed Yu Shi.

s4337.literal: First year of Duke Wu of Yan
s4337.idiomatic: First year of Duke Wu of Yan

s4342.literal: First year of Duke Xiang of Lu (Wu), besieged Song's Peng Cheng.
s4342.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xiang of Lu (Wu), besieged Song's Peng Cheng.

s4343.chinese: 十晉伐我，使太子光質於晉。
s4343.literal: Ten, Jin attacked us, sent crown prince Guang as hostage to Jin.
s4343.idiomatic: Ten, Jin attacked us, sent crown prince Guang as hostage to Jin.

s4344.literal: First year of Duke Dao of Jin, besieged Song's Peng Cheng.
s4344.idiomatic: First year of Duke Dao of Jin, besieged Song's Peng Cheng.

s4347.chinese: 四楚侵我，取犬丘。晉誅魚石，歸我彭城。
s4347.literal: Four, Chu invaded us, took Quan Qiu. Jin executed Yu Shi, returned Peng Cheng to us.
s4347.idiomatic: Four, Chu invaded us, took Quan Qiu. Jin executed Yu Shi, returned Peng Cheng to us.

s4352.chinese: 十三晉伐敗我，兵次洧上，楚來救。
s4352.literal: Thirteen, Jin attacked and defeated us, troops camped at Wei, Chu came to rescue.
s4352.idiomatic: Thirteen, Jin attacked and defeated us, troops camped at Wei, Chu came to rescue.

s4357.literal: Ling Wang first year gave birth to bearded child.
s4357.idiomatic: Ling Wang first year gave birth to bearded child.

s4358.literal: Two, assembled with Jin at Hu Lao fortress.
s4358.idiomatic: Two, assembled with Jin at Hu Lao fortress.

s4360.literal: Two, led feudal lords to attack Zheng, fortified Hu Lao.
s4360.idiomatic: Two, led feudal lords to attack Zheng, fortified Hu Lao.

s4368.chinese: 十四成公薨。晉率諸侯伐我。
s4368.literal: Fourteen, Cheng Gong died. Jin led feudal lords to attack us.
s4368.idiomatic: Fourteen, Cheng Gong died. Jin led feudal lords to attack us.

s4376.literal: Three, Wei Jiang insulted Yang Gan.
s4376.idiomatic: Three, Wei Jiang insulted Yang Gan.

s4378.chinese: 二十一使子重伐吳，至衡山。使何忌侵陳。
s4378.literal: Twenty-one, sent Zi Chong to attack Wu, reached Heng Mountain. Sent He Ji to invade Chen.
s4378.idiomatic: Twenty-one, sent Zi Chong to attack Wu, reached Heng Mountain. Sent He Ji to invade Chen.

s4381.literal: Twenty-nine, broke Chu alliance, Chu invaded us.
s4381.idiomatic: Twenty-nine, broke Chu alliance, Chu invaded us.

s4384.literal: First year of Duke Xi of Zheng (Yun)
s4384.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xi of Zheng (Yun)

s4392.chinese: 四魏絳說和戎、狄，狄朝晉。
s4392.literal: Four, Wei Jiang persuaded to make peace with Rong and Di, Di came to Jin court.
s4392.idiomatic: Four, Wei Jiang persuaded to make peace with Rong and Di, Di came to Jin court.

s4397.literal: Thirty, Chu attacked us. Cheng Gong died.
s4397.idiomatic: Thirty, Chu attacked us. Cheng Gong died.

s4413.literal: First year of Duke Ai of Chen (Ruo)
s4413.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ai of Chen (Ruo)

s4445.literal: Three, Chu besieged us, duke fled back.
s4445.idiomatic: Three, Chu besieged us, duke fled back.

s4448.chinese: 五子駟使賊夜殺釐公，詐以病卒赴諸侯。
s4448.literal: Five, Zi Si sent assassin to kill Xi Gong at night, falsely announced illness and death to feudal lords.
s4448.idiomatic: Five, Zi Si sent assassin to kill Xi Gong at night, falsely announced illness and death to feudal lords.

s4464.literal: First year of Duke Jian of Zheng (Jia), Xi Gong's son.
s4464.idiomatic: First year of Duke Jian of Zheng (Jia), Xi Gong's son.

s4470.chinese: 九與晉伐鄭，會河上，問公年十二，可冠，冠於衛。
s4470.literal: Nine, with Jin attacked Zheng, assembled at river, asked duke's age twelve, could be capped, capped at Wei.
s4470.idiomatic: Nine, with Jin attacked Zheng, assembled at river, asked duke's age twelve, could be capped, capped at Wei.

s4472.chinese: 九率齊、魯、宋、衛、曹伐鄭。秦伐我。
s4472.literal: Nine, led Qi, Lu, Song, Wei, Cao to attack Zheng. Qin attacked us.
s4472.idiomatic: Nine, led Qi, Lu, Song, Wei, Cao to attack Zheng. Qin attacked us.

s4473.literal: Thirteen, attacked Jin, Chu aided us.
s4473.idiomatic: Thirteen, attacked Jin, Chu aided us.

s4474.chinese: 二十七伐鄭，師于武城，為秦。
s4474.literal: Twenty-seven, attacked Zheng, camped at Wu Cheng, for Qin.
s4474.idiomatic: Twenty-seven, attacked Zheng, camped at Wu Cheng, for Qin.

s4475.literal: Twelve, Jin led us to attack Zheng.
s4475.idiomatic: Twelve, Jin led us to attack Zheng.

s4476.chinese: 十三晉率我伐鄭。師曹鞭公幸妾。
s4476.literal: Thirteen, Jin led us to attack Zheng. At Cao, duke favored consort.
s4476.idiomatic: Thirteen, Jin led us to attack Zheng. At Cao, duke favored consort.

s4479.literal: Fourteen, Jin led us to attack Zheng.
s4479.idiomatic: Fourteen, Jin led us to attack Zheng.

s4480.chinese: 二誅子駟。晉率諸侯伐我，我與盟。楚怒，伐我。
s4480.literal: Two, executed Zi Si. Jin led feudal lords to attack us, we made alliance. Chu angered, attacked us.
s4480.idiomatic: Two, executed Zi Si. Jin led feudal lords to attack us, we made alliance. Chu angered, attacked us.

s4485.literal: Nine, Wang Shu fled to Jin.
s4485.idiomatic: Nine, Wang Shu fled to Jin.

s4486.literal: Ten, Chu and Zheng invaded our western borders.
s4486.idiomatic: Ten, Chu and Zheng invaded our western borders.

s4487.chinese: 十九令太子光、高厚會諸侯鍾離。
s4487.literal: Nineteen, ordered crown prince Guang and Gao Hou to assemble feudal lords at Zhong Li.
s4487.idiomatic: Nineteen, ordered crown prince Guang and Gao Hou to assemble feudal lords at Zhong Li.

s4488.chinese: 十率諸侯伐鄭。荀罃伐秦。
s4488.literal: Ten, led feudal lords to attack Zheng. Xun Ying attacked Qin.
s4488.idiomatic: Ten, led feudal lords to attack Zheng. Xun Ying attacked Qin.

s4490.literal: Twenty-eight, sent Zi Nang to rescue Zheng.
s4490.idiomatic: Twenty-eight, sent Zi Nang to rescue Zheng.

s4491.literal: Thirteen, Zheng attacked us, Wei came to rescue.
s4491.idiomatic: Thirteen, Zheng attacked us, Wei came to rescue.

s4496.chinese: 三晉率諸侯伐我，楚來救。子孔作亂，子產攻之
s4496.literal: Three, Jin led feudal lords to attack us, Chu came to rescue. Zi Kong caused disorder, Zi Chan attacked him.
s4496.idiomatic: Three, Jin led feudal lords to attack us, Chu came to rescue. Zi Kong caused disorder, Zi Chan attacked him.

s4502.chinese: 十一三桓分為三軍，各將軍。
s4502.literal: Eleven, three Huan divided into three armies, each commanded army.
s4502.idiomatic: Eleven, three Huan divided into three armies, each commanded army.

s4504.literal: Eleven, led feudal lords to attack Zheng, Qin defeated us at Li. Duke said: 'I used Wei Jiang nine times to assemble feudal lords,' granted him music.
s4504.idiomatic: Eleven, led feudal lords to attack Zheng, Qin defeated us at Li. Duke said: 'I used Wei Jiang nine times to assemble feudal lords,' granted him music.

s4505.chinese: 十五我使庶長鮑伐晉救鄭，敗之櫟。
s4505.literal: Fifteen, we sent Shu Zhang Bao to attack Jin and rescue Zheng, defeated them at Li.
s4505.idiomatic: Fifteen, we sent Shu Zhang Bao to attack Jin and rescue Zheng, defeated them at Li.

s4507.literal: Fourteen, Chu and Zheng attacked us.
s4507.idiomatic: Fourteen, Chu and Zheng attacked us.

s4512.chinese: 四與楚伐宋，晉率諸侯伐我，秦來救。
s4512.literal: Four, with Chu attacked Song, Jin led feudal lords attacked us, Qin came to rescue.
s4512.idiomatic: Four, with Chu attacked Song, Jin led feudal lords attacked us, Qin came to rescue.

s4538.chinese: 三十一吳伐我，敗之。共王薨。
s4538.literal: Thirty-one, Wu attacked us, defeated them. King Gong died.
s4538.idiomatic: Thirty-one, Wu attacked us, defeated them. King Gong died.

s4546.literal: First year of Wu Zhu Fan, Chu defeated us.
s4546.idiomatic: First year of Wu Zhu Fan, Chu defeated us.

s4551.literal: Twenty-three, Wei Duke Xian came fleeing.
s4551.idiomatic: Twenty-three, Wei Duke Xian came fleeing.

s4552.chinese: 十四率諸侯大夫伐秦，敗棫林。
s4552.literal: Fourteen, led feudal lords' grandees to attack Qin, defeated at Yu Lin.
s4552.idiomatic: Fourteen, led feudal lords' grandees to attack Qin, defeated at Yu Lin.

s4553.chinese: 十八晉諸侯大夫伐我，敗棫林。
s4553.literal: Eighteen, Jin feudal lords' grandees attacked us, defeated at Yu Lin.
s4553.idiomatic: Eighteen, Jin feudal lords' grandees attacked us, defeated at Yu Lin.

s4554.chinese: 楚康王昭元年共王太子出奔吳。
s4554.literal: First year of King Kang of Chu (Zhao), King Gong's crown prince fled to Wu.
s4554.idiomatic: First year of King Kang of Chu (Zhao), King Gong's crown prince fled to Wu.

s4556.chinese: 十八孫文子攻公，公奔齊，立定公弟狄。
s4556.literal: Eighteen, Sun Wen Zi attacked the duke, duke fled to Qi, established Duke Ding's younger brother Di.
s4556.idiomatic: Eighteen, Sun Wen Zi attacked the duke, duke fled to Qi, established Duke Ding's younger brother Di.

s4562.literal: Two, Ji Zi yielded the throne. Chu attacked us.
s4562.idiomatic: Two, Ji Zi yielded the throne. Chu attacked us.

s4566.literal: Fifteen, solar eclipse. Qi attacked us.
s4566.idiomatic: Fifteen, solar eclipse. Qi attacked us.

s4572.literal: First year of Duke Shang of Wei (Di), Duke Ding's younger brother.
s4572.idiomatic: First year of Duke Shang of Wei (Di), Duke Ding's younger brother.

s4582.chinese: 十六齊伐我。地震。齊復伐我北鄙。
s4582.literal: Sixteen, Qi attacked us. Earthquake. Qi again attacked our northern borders.
s4582.idiomatic: Sixteen, Qi attacked us. Earthquake. Qi again attacked our northern borders.

s4584.chinese: 晉平公彪元年我敗楚于湛阪。
s4584.literal: First year of Duke Ping of Jin (Biao), we defeated Chu at Zhan Ban.
s4584.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ping of Jin (Biao), we defeated Chu at Zhan Ban.

s4586.literal: Three, Jin attacked us, defeated at Zhan Ban.
s4586.idiomatic: Three, Jin attacked us, defeated at Zhan Ban.

s4598.literal: Seventeen, Qi attacked our northern borders.
s4598.idiomatic: Seventeen, Qi attacked our northern borders.

s4615.literal: Twenty-seven, Jin besieged Lin Zi. Yan Ying.
s4615.idiomatic: Twenty-seven, Jin besieged Lin Zi. Yan Ying.

s4616.chinese: 三率魯、宋、鄭、衛圍齊，大破之。
s4616.literal: Three, led Lu, Song, Zheng, Wei to besiege Qi, greatly defeated them.
s4616.idiomatic: Three, led Lu, Song, Zheng, Wei to besiege Qi, greatly defeated them.

s4619.literal: Twenty-one, Jin led us to attack Qi.
s4619.idiomatic: Twenty-one, Jin led us to attack Qi.

s4624.chinese: 十一晉率我圍齊。楚伐我。
s4624.literal: Eleven, Jin led us to besiege Qi. Chu attacked us.
s4624.idiomatic: Eleven, Jin led us to besiege Qi. Chu attacked us.

s4631.chinese: 二十八廢光，立子牙為太子。光與崔杼殺牙自立。晉、衛伐我。

s4631.idiomatic: Twenty-eight, deposed Guang, established Zi Ya as crown prince. Guang and Cui Zhu assassinated Ya and self-established. Jin and Wei attacked us.

s4636.literal: Five, Jin led us to attack Qi.
s4636.idiomatic: Five, Jin led us to attack Qi.

s4639.literal: First year of Duke Wu of Cao (Sheng)
s4639.idiomatic: First year of Duke Wu of Cao (Sheng)

s4641.literal: First year of Duke Wen of Yan
s4641.idiomatic: First year of Duke Wen of Yan

s4647.literal: First year of Duke Zhuang of Qi
s4647.idiomatic: First year of Duke Zhuang of Qi

s4662.literal: Twenty-one, duke went to Jin. Sun eclipsed twice.
s4662.idiomatic: Twenty-one, duke went to Jin. Sun eclipsed twice.

s4664.literal: Six, Lu Duke Xiang came. Assassinated Yang She Hu.
s4664.idiomatic: Six, Lu Duke Xiang came. Assassinated Yang She Hu.

s4679.literal: Three, Jin Luan Ying came fleeing, Yan Ying said 'better to return him'.
s4679.idiomatic: Three, Jin Luan Ying came fleeing, Yan Ying said 'better to return him'.

s4680.literal: Seven, Luan Ying fled to Qi.
s4680.idiomatic: Seven, Luan Ying fled to Qi.

s4695.idiomatic: Four, wished to send Luan Ying to enter Quwo to attack Jin, take Zhao Ge.

s4710.literal: Twenty-four, invaded Qi. Sun eclipsed twice.
s4710.idiomatic: Twenty-four, invaded Qi. Sun eclipsed twice.

s4711.literal: Five, feared Jin communicated with Chu, Yan Ying plotted.
s4711.idiomatic: Five, feared Jin communicated with Chu, Yan Ying plotted.

s4714.literal: Eleven, communicated with Qi. Led Chen, Cai attacked Zheng rescued Qi.
s4714.idiomatic: Eleven, communicated with Qi. Led Chen, Cai attacked Zheng rescued Qi.

s4717.literal: Twenty, Chu led us to attack Zheng.
s4717.idiomatic: Twenty, Chu led us to attack Zheng.

s4718.literal: Forty-three, Chu led us to attack Zheng.
s4718.idiomatic: Forty-three, Chu led us to attack Zheng.

s4720.literal: Seventeen, Fan Xuan Zi governed. We requested to attack Chen.
s4720.idiomatic: Seventeen, Fan Xuan Zi governed. We requested to attack Chen.

s4726.literal: Twenty-five, Qi attacked our northern borders, to avenge Xiao Bo's army.
s4726.idiomatic: Twenty-five, Qi attacked our northern borders, to avenge Xiao Bo's army.

s4727.idiomatic: Six, Jin attacked us, avenged Zhao Ge. Cui Zhu because Duke Zhuang seduced his wife, assassinated him, established his younger brother as Duke Jing.

s4728.literal: Ten, attacked Qi to Gao Tang, avenged Tai Xing campaign.
s4728.idiomatic: Ten, attacked Qi to Gao Tang, avenged Tai Xing campaign.

s4729.literal: Twenty-nine, duke went to Jin, alliance not concluded.
s4729.idiomatic: Twenty-nine, duke went to Jin, alliance not concluded.

s4730.chinese: 十二吳伐我，以報舟師之役，射殺吳王。
s4730.literal: Twelve, Wu attacked us, to avenge naval campaign, shot and killed Wu king.
s4730.idiomatic: Twelve, Wu attacked us, to avenge naval campaign, shot and killed Wu king.

s4737.literal: First year of Duke Yi of Yan
s4737.idiomatic: First year of Duke Yi of Yan

s4738.literal: Thirteen, Zhu Fan attacked Chu, pressed Nest Gate, injured by arrow died.
s4738.idiomatic: Thirteen, Zhu Fan attacked Chu, pressed Nest Gate, injured by arrow died.

s4743.literal: First year of Qi Duke Jing (Chu Jiu), went to Jin, requested return Wei Duke Xian.
s4743.idiomatic: First year of Qi Duke Jing (Chu Jiu), went to Jin, requested return Wei Duke Xian.

s4744.chinese: 十一誅衛殤公，復入獻公。
s4744.literal: Eleven, executed Wei Duke Shang, re-entered Duke Xian.
s4744.idiomatic: Eleven, executed Wei Duke Shang, re-entered Duke Xian.

s4746.literal: Thirteen, led Chen, Cai attacked Zheng.
s4746.idiomatic: Thirteen, led Chen, Cai attacked Zheng.

s4748.chinese: 十二齊、晉殺殤公，復內獻公。
s4748.literal: Twelve, Qi, Jin executed Duke Shang, re-entered Duke Xian.
s4748.idiomatic: Twelve, Qi, Jin executed Duke Shang, re-entered Duke Xian.

s4749.literal: Twenty-two, Chu led us to attack Zheng.
s4749.idiomatic: Twenty-two, Chu led us to attack Zheng.

s4752.literal: Nineteen, Chu led Chen, Cai to attack us.
s4752.idiomatic: Nineteen, Chu led Chen, Cai to attack us.

s4754.literal: First year of Wu Yu Ji
s4754.idiomatic: First year of Wu Yu Ji

s4759.chinese: 二慶封欲專，誅崔氏，杼自殺。
s4759.literal: Two, Qing Feng wished monopoly, executed Cui clan, Zhu committed suicide.
s4759.idiomatic: Two, Qing Feng wished monopoly, executed Cui clan, Zhu committed suicide.

s4764.literal: First year of Wei Duke Xian (Kan) later
s4764.idiomatic: First year of Wei Duke Xian (Kan) later

s4774.literal: Twenty-eight, duke went to Chu. Buried King Kang.
s4774.idiomatic: Twenty-eight, duke went to Chu. Buried King Kang.

s4775.chinese: 三冬，鮑、高、欒氏謀慶封，發兵攻慶封，慶封奔吳。
s4775.literal: Three, winter, Bao, Gao, Luan clans plotted against Qing Feng, sent troops attacked Qing Feng, Qing Feng fled to Wu.
s4775.idiomatic: Three, winter, Bao, Gao, Luan clans plotted against Qing Feng, sent troops attacked Qing Feng, Qing Feng fled to Wu.

s4786.literal: Three, Qi Qing Feng came fleeing.
s4786.idiomatic: Three, Qi Qing Feng came fleeing.

s4790.chinese: 二十九吳季札來觀周樂，盡知樂所為。
s4790.literal: Twenty-nine, Wu Ji Zha came to observe Zhou music, knew all music meanings.
s4790.idiomatic: Twenty-nine, Wu Ji Zha came to observe Zhou music, knew all music meanings.

s4791.chinese: 四吳季札來使，與晏嬰歡。
s4791.literal: Four, Wu Ji Zha came as envoy, happy with Yan Ying.
s4791.idiomatic: Four, Wu Ji Zha came as envoy, happy with Yan Ying.

s4792.chinese: 十四吳季札來，曰「晉政卒歸韓、魏、趙。」
s4792.literal: Fourteen, Wu Ji Zha came, said 'Jin government finally belongs to Han, Wei, Zhao.'
s4792.idiomatic: Fourteen, Wu Ji Zha came, said 'Jin government finally belongs to Han, Wei, Zhao.'

s4794.literal: First year of Chu Xiong Ju Ao
s4794.idiomatic: First year of Chu Xiong Ju Ao

s4800.chinese: 二十二吳季札謂子產曰：政將歸子，子以禮，幸脫於厄矣。」
s4800.literal: Twenty-two, Wu Ji Zha told Zi Chan: 'Government will belong to you, if you use ritual, fortunately escape calamity.'
s4800.idiomatic: Twenty-two, Wu Ji Zha told Zi Chan: 'Government will belong to you, if you use ritual, fortunately escape calamity.'

s4801.chinese: 燕惠公元年齊高止來奔。
s4801.literal: First year of Duke Hui of Yan, Qi Gao Zhi came fleeing.
s4801.idiomatic: First year of Duke Hui of Yan, Qi Gao Zhi came fleeing.

s4802.chinese: 四守門閽殺餘祭。季札使諸侯。
s4802.literal: Four, gatekeeper assassinated Yu Ji. Ji Zha made feudal lords.
s4802.idiomatic: Four, gatekeeper assassinated Yu Ji. Ji Zha made feudal lords.

s4812.literal: First year of Duke Xiang of Wei (Wu)
s4812.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xiang of Wei (Wu)

s4814.chinese: 四十九為太子取楚女，公通焉，太子殺公自立。
s4814.literal: Forty-nine, took Chu woman for crown prince, duke seduced her, crown prince assassinated duke self-established.
s4814.idiomatic: Forty-nine, took Chu woman for crown prince, duke seduced her, crown prince assassinated duke self-established.

s4816.chinese: 二十三諸公子爭寵相殺，又欲殺子產，子成止之。
s4816.literal: Twenty-three, various princes contended for favor killed each other, also wished to kill Zi Chan, Zi Cheng stopped them.
s4816.idiomatic: Twenty-three, various princes contended for favor killed each other, also wished to kill Zi Chan, Zi Cheng stopped them.

s4826.literal: Three, Wang Ji Fu became Ling Yin.
s4826.idiomatic: Three, Wang Ji Fu became Ling Yin.

s4830.literal: First year of Duke Ling of Cai (Ban)
s4830.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ling of Cai (Ban)

s4838.chinese: 魯昭公稠元年昭公年十九，有童心。
s4838.literal: First year of Duke Zhao of Lu (Chou), Duke Zhao age nineteen, had childish heart.
s4838.idiomatic: First year of Duke Zhao of Lu (Chou), Duke Zhao age nineteen, had childish heart.

s4840.literal: Seventeen, Qin Hou Zi came fleeing.
s4840.idiomatic: Seventeen, Qin Hou Zi came fleeing.

s4841.chinese: 三十六公弟后子奔晉，車千乘。
s4841.literal: Thirty-six, duke's younger brother Hou Zi fled to Jin, thousand chariots.
s4841.idiomatic: Thirty-six, duke's younger brother Hou Zi fled to Jin, thousand chariots.

s4842.chinese: 四令尹圍殺郟敖，自立為靈王。
s4842.literal: Four, Ling Yin Wei assassinated Ju Ao, self-established as King Ling.
s4842.idiomatic: Four, Ling Yin Wei assassinated Ju Ao, self-established as King Ling.

s4854.chinese: 二公如晉，至河，晉謝還之。
s4854.literal: Two, duke went to Jin, reached river, Jin apologized returned him.
s4854.idiomatic: Two, duke went to Jin, reached river, Jin apologized returned him.

s4855.literal: Eight, Tian Wu Yu sent woman.
s4855.idiomatic: Eight, Tian Wu Yu sent woman.

s4856.literal: Eighteen, Qi Tian Wu Yu came to send a woman.
s4856.idiomatic: Eighteen, Qi Tian Wu Yu came to send a woman.

s4858.chinese: 楚靈王圍元年共王子，肘玉。
s4858.literal: First year of King Ling of Chu (Wei), King Gong's son, Zhou Yu.
s4858.idiomatic: First year of King Ling of Chu (Wei), King Gong's son, Zhou Yu.

s4871.chinese: 九晏嬰使晉，見叔向，曰「齊政歸田氏。」叔向曰：「晉公室卑。」
s4871.literal: Nine, Yan Ying sent to Jin, saw Shu Xiang, said 'Qi governance belongs to Tian clan.' Shu Xiang said: 'Jin ducal house is lowly.'
s4871.idiomatic: Nine, Yan Ying sent to Jin, saw Shu Xiang, said 'Qi governance belongs to Tian clan.' Shu Xiang said: 'Jin ducal house is lowly.'

s4880.literal: Twenty-seven, summer, went to Jin. Winter, went to Chu.
s4880.idiomatic: Twenty-seven, summer, went to Jin. Winter, went to Chu.

s4881.chinese: 六公欲殺公卿立幸臣，公卿誅幸臣，公恐，出奔齊。
s4881.literal: Six, duke wished to kill ministers and establish favored servants, ministers executed favored servants, duke feared, fled to Qi.
s4881.idiomatic: Six, duke wished to kill ministers and establish favored servants, ministers executed favored servants, duke feared, fled to Qi.

s5527.literal: Fifty, sent female musicians to Lu.
s5527.idiomatic: Fifty, sent female musicians to Lu.

s5544.literal: Fifteen, Zhao Yang attacked Fan, Zhong Xing.
s5544.idiomatic: Fifteen, Zhao Yang attacked Fan, Zhong Xing.

s5548.chinese: 三十八孔子來，祿之如魯。
s5548.literal: Thirty-eight, Confucius came, gave salary like in Lu.
s5548.idiomatic: Thirty-eight, Confucius came, gave salary like in Lu.

s5564.literal: Thirty-nine, crown prince Kuai Kui fled.
s5564.idiomatic: Thirty-nine, crown prince Kuai Kui fled.

s5567.chinese: 六公孫彊好射，獻鴈，君使為司城，夢者子行。
s5567.literal: Six, Gong Sun Qiang fond of archery, offered geese, ruler made him Si Cheng, dreamers' son departed.
s5567.idiomatic: Six, Gong Sun Qiang fond of archery, offered geese, ruler made him Si Cheng, dreamers' son departed.

s5570.chinese: 十九伐越，敗我，傷闔閭指，以死。
s5570.literal: Nineteen, attacked Yue, defeated us, injured He Lu finger, died from it.
s5570.idiomatic: Nineteen, attacked Yue, defeated us, injured He Lu finger, died from it.

s5574.literal: Fifteen, Duke Ding died. Solar eclipse.
s5574.idiomatic: Fifteen, Duke Ding died. Solar eclipse.

s5578.chinese: 二十一滅胡。以吳敗，我倍之。
s5578.literal: Twenty-one, extinguished Hu. Because Wu defeated us, broke with them.
s5578.idiomatic: Twenty-one, extinguished Hu. Because Wu defeated us, broke with them.

s5586.literal: First year of Wu King Fu Chai
s5586.idiomatic: First year of Wu King Fu Chai

s5590.literal: First year of Duke Ai of Lu (Jiang)
s5590.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ai of Lu (Jiang)

s5592.chinese: 十八趙鞅圍范、中行朝歌。齊、衛伐我。
s5592.literal: Eighteen, Zhao Yang besieged Fan and Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge. Qi and Wei attacked us.
s5592.idiomatic: Eighteen, Zhao Yang besieged Fan and Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge. Qi and Wei attacked us.

s5594.literal: Twenty-two, led feudal lords to besiege Cai.
s5594.idiomatic: Twenty-two, led feudal lords to besiege Cai.

s5598.chinese: 二十五楚伐我，以吳怨故。
s5598.literal: Twenty-five, Chu attacked us, because of Wu resentment.
s5598.idiomatic: Twenty-five, Chu attacked us, because of Wu resentment.

s5607.literal: Fifty-five, transported grain to Fan and Zhong Xing clan.
s5607.idiomatic: Fifty-five, transported grain to Fan and Zhong Xing clan.

s5608.chinese: 十九趙鞅圍范、中行，鄭來救，我敗之。
s5608.literal: Nineteen, Zhao Yang besieged Fan and Zhong Xing, Zheng came to rescue, we defeated them.
s5608.idiomatic: Nineteen, Zhao Yang besieged Fan and Zhong Xing, Zheng came to rescue, we defeated them.

s5612.chinese: 四十二靈公薨。蒯聵子輒立。晉納太子蒯聵于戚。
s5612.literal: Forty-two, Duke Ling died. Kuai Kui's son Zhe established. Jin brought crown prince Kuai Kui to Qi.
s5612.idiomatic: Forty-two, Duke Ling died. Kuai Kui's son Zhe established. Jin brought crown prince Kuai Kui to Qi.

s5614.chinese: 二十六畏楚，私召吳人，乞遷于州來，州來近吳。
s5614.literal: Twenty-six, feared Chu, secretly summoned Wu people, begged to move to Zhou Lai, Zhou Lai near Wu.
s5614.idiomatic: Twenty-six, feared Chu, secretly summoned Wu people, begged to move to Zhou Lai, Zhou Lai near Wu.

s5616.chinese: 八救范、中行氏，與趙鞅戰於鐵，敗我師。
s5616.literal: Eight, rescued Fan and Zhong Xing clan, fought with Zhao Yang at Tie, defeated our army.
s5616.idiomatic: Eight, rescued Fan and Zhong Xing clan, fought with Zhao Yang at Tie, defeated our army.

s5627.chinese: 二十五孔子過宋，桓魋惡之。
s5627.literal: Twenty-five, Confucius passed through Song, Huan Hui disliked him.
s5627.idiomatic: Twenty-five, Confucius passed through Song, Huan Hui disliked him.

s5628.literal: First year of Wei Chu Gong (Zhe)
s5628.idiomatic: First year of Wei Chu Gong (Zhe)

s5633.literal: First year of Duke Xian of Yan
s5633.idiomatic: First year of Duke Xian of Yan

s5639.literal: Fifty-seven, begged to rescue Fan clan.
s5639.idiomatic: Fifty-seven, begged to rescue Fan clan.

s5640.chinese: 二十一趙鞅拔邯鄲、柏人，有之。
s5640.literal: Twenty-one, Zhao Yang took Han Dan and Bo Ren, possessed them.
s5640.idiomatic: Twenty-one, Zhao Yang took Han Dan and Bo Ren, possessed them.

s5646.literal: Twenty-eight, grandees together executed Duke Zhao.
s5646.idiomatic: Twenty-eight, grandees together executed Duke Zhao.

s5655.chinese: 五十八景公薨。立嬖姬子為太子。
s5655.literal: Fifty-eight, Duke Jing died. Established favored consort's son as crown prince.
s5655.idiomatic: Fifty-eight, Duke Jing died. Established favored consort's son as crown prince.

s5656.chinese: 二十二趙鞅敗范中行，中行奔齊。伐衛。
s5656.literal: Twenty-two, Zhao Yang defeated Fan Zhong Xing, Zhong Xing fled to Qi. Attacked Wei.
s5656.idiomatic: Twenty-two, Zhao Yang defeated Fan Zhong Xing, Zhong Xing fled to Qi. Attacked Wei.

s5657.literal: First year of Duke Dao of Qin
s5657.idiomatic: First year of Duke Dao of Qin

s5660.literal: Three, Jin attacked us, because of rescuing Fan clan.
s5660.idiomatic: Three, Jin attacked us, because of rescuing Fan clan.

s5662.literal: First year of Duke Cheng of Cai (Shuo)
s5662.idiomatic: First year of Duke Cheng of Cai (Shuo)

s5671.chinese: 齊晏孺子元年田乞詐立陽生，殺孺子。
s5671.literal: First year of Qi Yan Ru Zi, Tian Qi falsely established Yang Sheng, killed Ru Zi.
s5671.idiomatic: First year of Qi Yan Ru Zi, Tian Qi falsely established Yang Sheng, killed Ru Zi.

s5674.literal: Twenty-seven, rescued Chen, king died at Cheng Fu.
s5674.idiomatic: Twenty-seven, rescued Chen, king died at Cheng Fu.

s5677.literal: Thirteen, Wu attacked us, Chu came to rescue.
s5677.idiomatic: Thirteen, Wu attacked us, Chu came to rescue.

s5686.chinese: 七公會吳王于繒。吳徵百牢，季康子使子貢謝之。
s5686.literal: Seven, duke assembled with Wu king at Zeng. Wu demanded hundred sacrificial animals, Ji Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to decline.
s5686.idiomatic: Seven, duke assembled with Wu king at Zeng. Wu demanded hundred sacrificial animals, Ji Kang Zi sent Zi Gong to decline.

s5687.literal: First year of Duke Dao of Qi (Yang Sheng)
s5687.idiomatic: First year of Duke Dao of Qi (Yang Sheng)

s5690.literal: First year of King Hui of Chu (Zhang)
s5690.idiomatic: First year of King Hui of Chu (Zhang)

s5695.literal: Fourteen, Song besieged us, Zheng rescued us.
s5695.idiomatic: Fourteen, Song besieged us, Zheng rescued us.

s5698.literal: Eight, Lu assembled with us at Zeng.
s5698.idiomatic: Eight, Lu assembled with us at Zeng.

s5702.chinese: 八吳為邾伐我，至城下，盟而去。齊取我三邑。
s5702.literal: Eight, Wu for Zhu attacked us, reached city walls, made alliance and withdrew. Qi took our three towns.
s5702.idiomatic: Eight, Wu for Zhu attacked us, reached city walls, made alliance and withdrew. Qi took our three towns.

s5703.literal: Two, attacked Lu, took three towns.
s5703.idiomatic: Two, attacked Lu, took three towns.

s5706.chinese: 二子西召建子勝於吳，為白公。
s5706.literal: Two, Zi Xi summoned Jian Zi Sheng from Wu, became Bai Gong.
s5706.idiomatic: Two, Zi Xi summoned Jian Zi Sheng from Wu, became Bai Gong.

s5707.literal: Thirty, Cao doubled us, we extinguished them.
s5707.idiomatic: Thirty, Cao doubled us, we extinguished them.

s5711.literal: Fifteen, Song extinguished Cao, captured Bo Yang.
s5711.idiomatic: Fifteen, Song extinguished Cao, captured Bo Yang.

s5722.literal: Three, attacked Chen, because of Chen and Wu alliance.
s5722.idiomatic: Three, attacked Chen, because of Chen and Wu alliance.

s5723.chinese: 三十一鄭圍我，敗之于雍丘。
s5723.literal: Thirty-one, Zheng besieged us, defeated them at Yong Qiu.
s5723.idiomatic: Thirty-one, Zheng besieged us, defeated them at Yong Qiu.

s5725.literal: Sixteen, doubled Chu, allied with Wu.
s5725.idiomatic: Sixteen, doubled Chu, allied with Wu.

s5728.chinese: 十五圍宋，敗我師雍丘，伐我。
s5728.literal: Fifteen, besieged Song, defeated our army at Yong Qiu, attacked us.
s5728.idiomatic: Fifteen, besieged Song, defeated our army at Yong Qiu, attacked us.

s5735.chinese: 四吳、魯伐我。鮑子殺悼公，齊人立其子壬為簡公。
s5735.literal: Four, Wu and Lu attacked us. Bao Zi assassinated Duke Dao, Qi people established his son Ren as Duke Jian.
s5735.idiomatic: Four, Wu and Lu attacked us. Bao Zi assassinated Duke Dao, Qi people established his son Ren as Duke Jian.

s5736.literal: Twenty-seven, sent Zhao Yang to attack Qi.
s5736.idiomatic: Twenty-seven, sent Zhao Yang to attack Qi.

s5746.chinese: 十一與魯伐齊救陳。誅五員。
s5746.literal: Eleven, with Lu attacked Qi to rescue Chen. Executed Wu Yuan.
s5746.idiomatic: Eleven, with Lu attacked Qi to rescue Chen. Executed Wu Yuan.

s5750.chinese: 十一齊伐我。冉有言，故迎孔子，孔子歸。
s5750.literal: Eleven, Qi attacked us. Ran You spoke, therefore welcomed Confucius, Confucius returned.
s5750.idiomatic: Eleven, Qi attacked us. Ran You spoke, therefore welcomed Confucius, Confucius returned.

s5751.chinese: 齊簡公元年魯與吳敗我。
s5751.literal: First year of Duke Jian of Qi, Lu with Wu defeated us.
s5751.idiomatic: First year of Duke Jian of Qi, Lu with Wu defeated us.

s5766.chinese: 十二與吳會橐皋。用田賦。
s5766.literal: Twelve, with Wu assembled at Tao Gao. Used field tax.
s5766.idiomatic: Twelve, with Wu assembled at Tao Gao. Used field tax.

s5770.chinese: 六白公勝數請子西伐鄭，以父怨故。
s5770.literal: Six, Bai Gong Sheng repeatedly requested Zi Xi to attack Zheng, because of father's resentment.
s5770.idiomatic: Six, Bai Gong Sheng repeatedly requested Zi Xi to attack Zheng, because of father's resentment.

s5772.literal: Ten, duke went to Jin, with Wu assembled at Tao Gao.
s5772.idiomatic: Ten, duke went to Jin, with Wu assembled at Tao Gao.

s5778.literal: Thirteen, with Lu assembled at Tao Gao.
s5778.idiomatic: Thirteen, with Lu assembled at Tao Gao.

s5782.literal: Thirteen, with Wu assembled at Huang Chi.
s5782.idiomatic: Thirteen, with Wu assembled at Huang Chi.

s5784.literal: Thirty, with Wu assembled at Huang Chi, contended for precedence.
s5784.idiomatic: Thirty, with Wu assembled at Huang Chi, contended for precedence.

s5794.literal: Fourteen, with Jin assembled at Huang Chi.
s5794.idiomatic: Fourteen, with Jin assembled at Huang Chi.

s5798.chinese: 十四西狩獲麟。衛出公來奔。
s5798.literal: Fourteen, western hunt captured unicorn. Wei Chu Gong came fleeing.
s5798.idiomatic: Fourteen, western hunt captured unicorn. Wei Chu Gong came fleeing.

s5799.chinese: 四田常殺簡公，立其弟驁，為平公，常相之，專國權。
s5799.literal: Four, Tian Chang assassinated Duke Jian, established his younger brother Ao as Duke Ping, Chang became chancellor, monopolized state power.
s5799.idiomatic: Four, Tian Chang assassinated Duke Jian, established his younger brother Ao as Duke Ping, Chang became chancellor, monopolized state power.

s5804.literal: Twelve, father Kuai Kui entered, Zhe fled.
s5804.idiomatic: Twelve, father Kuai Kui entered, Zhe fled.

s5814.chinese: 十五子服景伯使齊，子貢為介，齊歸我侵地。
s5814.literal: Fifteen, Zi Fu Jing Bo sent to Qi, Zi Gong as intermediary, Qi returned our invaded territory.
s5814.idiomatic: Fifteen, Zi Fu Jing Bo sent to Qi, Zi Gong as intermediary, Qi returned our invaded territory.

s5815.chinese: 齊平公驁元年景公孫也。齊自是稱田氏。
s5815.literal: First year of Duke Ping of Qi (Ao), Duke Jing's grandson. Qi from this called Tian clan.
s5815.idiomatic: First year of Duke Ping of Qi (Ao), Duke Jing's grandson. Qi from this called Tian clan.

s5819.chinese: 三十七熒惑守心，子韋曰「善。」
s5819.literal: Thirty-seven, Mars guarded Heart, Zi Wei said 'good.'
s5819.idiomatic: Thirty-seven, Mars guarded Heart, Zi Wei said 'good.'

s5820.literal: First year of Duke Zhuang of Wei (Kuai Kui)
s5820.idiomatic: First year of Duke Zhuang of Wei (Kuai Kui)

s5834.chinese: 十白公勝殺令尹子西，攻惠王。葉公攻白公，白公自殺。惠王復國。
s5834.literal: Ten, Bai Gong Sheng assassinated Ling Yin Zi Xi, attacked King Hui. Ye Gong attacked Bai Gong, Bai Gong committed suicide. King Hui restored the state.
s5834.idiomatic: Ten, Bai Gong Sheng assassinated Ling Yin Zi Xi, attacked King Hui. Ye Gong attacked Bai Gong, Bai Gong committed suicide. King Hui restored the state.

s5837.literal: Twenty-three, Chu extinguished Chen, assassinated Duke Min.
s5837.idiomatic: Twenty-three, Chu extinguished Chen, assassinated Duke Min.

s5852.chinese: 三莊公辱戎州人，戎州人與趙簡子攻莊公，出奔。
s5852.literal: Three, Duke Zhuang insulted Rong Zhou people, Rong Zhou people with Zhao Jian Zi attacked Duke Zhuang, fled.
s5852.idiomatic: Three, Duke Zhuang insulted Rong Zhou people, Rong Zhou people with Zhao Jian Zi attacked Duke Zhuang, fled.

s5865.literal: Fourteen, died, son Duke Li Gong established.
s5865.idiomatic: Fourteen, died, son Duke Li Gong established.

s5868.chinese: 衛君起元年石傅逐起出，輒復入。
s5868.literal: First year of Wei Jun Qi, Shi Fu drove Qi out, Zhe re-entered.
s5868.idiomatic: First year of Wei Jun Qi, Shi Fu drove Qi out, Zhe re-entered.

s5876.chinese: 太史公曰：儒者斷其義，馳說者騁其辭，不務綜其終始；
s5876.literal: The Grand Historian says: The Confucians sever their meanings, the galloping explainers gallop with their words, they do not strive to comprehensively grasp beginning and end;
s5876.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: The Confucians sever their meanings, the galloping explainers gallop with their words, they do not strive to comprehensively grasp beginning and end;

s5877.chinese: 歷人取其年月，數家隆於神運，譜諜獨記世謚，其辭略，欲一觀諸要難。
s5877.literal: The calendar makers take their years and months, several schools exalt divine destiny, the chronological records and secret accounts only record posthumous titles, their words are concise, but to view the essentials comprehensively is difficult.
s5877.idiomatic: The calendar makers take their years and months, several schools exalt divine destiny, the chronological records and secret accounts only record posthumous titles, their words are concise, but to view the essentials comprehensively is difficult.

s5878.chinese: 於是譜十二諸侯，自共和訖孔子，表見春秋、國語學者所譏盛衰大指著于篇，為成學治古文者要刪焉。
s5878.literal: Therefore I have calendared the twelve feudal lords, from the Gonghe administration until Confucius, making manifest in tables the great outlines of rise and decline criticized by Spring and Autumn Annals and Discourses of the States scholars, written in this chapter as a key summary for those who study and treat ancient texts.
s5878.idiomatic: Therefore I have calendared the twelve feudal lords, from the Gonghe administration until Confucius, making manifest in tables the great outlines of rise and decline criticized by Spring and Autumn Annals and Discourses of the States scholars, written in this chapter as a key summary for those who study and treat ancient texts.
